author: VIKITALA
body:
I am trying to get column data and assign it to a variable which I want to later compare with a value of another variable using Invoke-Sqlcmd command. I am able to get data from the table but its coming with column header. Is there away how I can only get data without the column header? I have tried to use Select -ExpandProperty but I am getting errors. Below is the code and error message I am getting
$dbVersion =Invoke-Sqlcmd -server localhost -Database Test 'Select versionno from Employee where id =1'
PS SQLSERVER:> $dbVersion =$dbVersion | Select -ExpandProperty $dbVersion
Select : Property "System.Data.DataRow" cannot be found.
At line:1 char:26
$dbVersion =$dbVersion | Select -ExpandProperty $dbVersion
                     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
CategoryInfo : InvalidArgument: (System.Data.DataRow:PSObject) [Select-Object], PSArgumentException
FullyQualifiedErrorId : ExpandPropertyNotFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.SelectObjectCommand

comments.author: VIKITALA
comments.body:
I have managed to get only data in the column without column headers. Below is the final fine code
PS SQLSERVER:\> $Version =Get-Content -Path C:\Users\Admin\Documents\MSSQLScripts\Db-Version.txt
PS SQLSERVER:\> $dbVersion =Invoke-Sqlcmd -server localhost -Database Test 'Select versionno from Employee where id =1'
PS SQLSERVER:\> $dbVersion =$dbVersion | Select -ExpandProperty **versionno**
In this case Versionno is the column header in the db and I have supplied it with the Select -ExpandProperty command.
That solved my problem.

title: How can I get only data without column headers when i use  Invoke-Sqlcmd
